page.title: 17HOYLAKE LIFEBOAT
page.content:
The Hoylake Lifeboat,{Mary Gabriel, serves the area of Liverpool Bay from Point of Ayr to the Ribble estuary. It is a self-righting lifeboat, housed on the promenade and has to be drawn by tractor into deep water. This can take 14 minutes at low tide. Top speed is 8-9 knots and in high waves it tows a sheet anchor to help stability.
The crew of 7 men is drawn from a team of 16. All have regular jobs in the local area and are alerted by maroons and 'personal bleepers' when there is an emergency.
"My first impression was how small the boat was, but the anchor was larger than I had imagined", said Clare, after visiting the Lifeboat Station.
